Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below with large lotus-palmette in added white outline with red centres; exterior: row of dots art rim above band of Z between pairs of dilute lines; below, part of pendant roundel as filling ornament and, part of undetermined motif, probably back of animal.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 264, no. 563)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 82, no. 24, pl. V)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0635) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
